text: Sopiko Guramishvili (; born 1 January 1991) is a Georgian chess player. She was awarded by FIDE the titles Woman Grandmaster (WGM) in 2009 and International Master (IM) in 2012. She competed in the Women's World Chess Championship in 2015 and 2017. ==Chess career== She won the girls U16 section of the World Youth Chess Championship in 2006.World Youth Chess Championship 2006 Girls -16. chess-results.com. In 2004, Guramishvili won a match with Irene Kharisma Sukandar ("Enerpac Chess Match") in Jakarta by 4-2. She won the bronze medal in the women's event of the 2010 World University Chess Championship in Zurich. In January 2012, Guramishvili won the women's round- robin event of the Reggio Emilia chess tournament. In October 2015, Guramishvili won a six-game match with European U16 girls champion Anna-Maja Kazarian by a score of 5.5-0.5 at the Hoogeveen Chess Festival. ==Personal life== On 18 July 2015 Sopiko Guramishvili married the Dutch grandmaster Anish Giri.Another Chess Wedding: Anish Giri becomes a Son in Law of Georgia, and Sopiko Guramishvili Marries One of the World's Top Players - chess-news.ru, 18 July 2015 On 3 October 2016, while Giri was playing the Tal Memorial, their son Daniel was born. ==References== == External links == * *Sopiko Guramishvili chess games at 365Chess.com * Category:1991 births Category:Living people Category:Chess International Masters Category:Chess woman grandmasters Category:World Youth Chess Champions Category:Female chess players from Georgia (country) Category:Sportspeople from Tbilisi
title: Sopiko Guramishvili
